opt_help_desc.message: There must be something U need to know

opt_hp_abtct.message: This extension is based on chrome webrequest api, can be used to manage browser requests simply. Its main feature contains Blocking Request (Block), forcing to use HTTPS connections (HTTPS), helping you browse anti-hotlinking images (Hotlinking), monitoring network request (Log). You just need to enter a URL pattern (i.e., rules) and enable related function. In additional, I added QR Code function, hope you like it. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me at evecalm@live.com.

opt_hp_rulect1.message: The format of the rule mainly refers to Match Patterns. I made a little change to apply it in my extension: a rule can only matches requests over https and http protocol , and requests over file, FTP or other protocols will not be matched. A rule contains three parts: the protocol, domain, path (including query string). In the rule, an asterisk (*) is a special symbol means any possible thing.

opt_hp_rulect3.message: Host: consist of alphanumeric characters and connected with dots, such as: www.google.com, chrome.google.com . * can also be used in the host, but it can only be the first or the only one character. And yes, you can use IP address too.

opt_hp_rulect4.message: Path: consist of alphanumeric and some special symbols (-_ + = &% @!.,?|~/), you can also use * . If the path is left blank, then it will be treated as *, that is, any path.

opt_hp_rulect5.message: When Adding a rule, you can paste a URL into the domain input box, the extension will do the rest for you automatically.

opt_hp_blockct.message: You can add patterns to block certain websites, specific images or scripts. Of course, it can be used to block ads, but I do not recommend doing this, this extension does not aim at blocking ads, you can install Adblock to do this.

opt_hp_hstsct.message: If a website supports HTTPS, you can add its domain as a rule, then all requests to this site will go through HTTPS. For example, wordpress.com supports HTTPS, then after adding *.wordpress.com as a rule, all blogs including blogs' pictures on wordpress.com will be connected via HTTPS.

opt_hp_hotct.message: You may have seen many fake pictures because of hotlinking-prevention. For now, just right click the picture and click "copy image URL", then paste it into the domain input box (clear the path input box so this rule will apply to all pictures under this domain). After this, you can see the original pictures.

opt_hp_logct.message: Inspect network requests' details including request header (header) and content (body). See the figure below.

opt_hp_qrct.message: When surfing the internet, you can click the blue earth icon on the right side of the location bar, then a QR code of the web page's URL will be generated. And you can double click the QR code, edit the content and get a new QR code. After this, use your mobile app to scan them! It's an easy way to share messages from PC to phone. This feature is powered by Google API, so make sure you can access Goolg API before using it.

opt_ena_google_lbl.message: Stop Google search results from redirecting

opt_ena_gstatic_lbl.message: Speed up website using Google CDN(by redirecting request Google CDN to 360safe's cdn, for Chinese only)

gsearch_rule_detail.message:
by default, google.com and google.com.hk are added to the list.
You can also add/edit your preferred google domain(or ip).
You've added as your preferred Google domain.

input_dlg_hint.message: This also can be ip addr. If empty, previous domain will be removed.

want_new_feature.message: Considering another awesome feature could be done with this extension? JUST TELL ME NOW!
